No matter how many times people like you justify this power grab and the (illegal?) appointing of MR, it's obvious the MAJORITY of this country's citizens are against this move.  The comments here prove that.  Hence the delaying tactics at the parliamentary level and the massive propaganda efforts currently underway on the ground level with posters, banners etc..  And except for perhaps Swaziland, I guarantee no other foreign nation is looking at this recent events in a positive manner. In fact it's a certain now that foreign interference will further INCREASE after this event.  So much for the strong, powerful & cunning king that is MR. He may win the top seat, but he will lose the country in the process. LOL

this is not correct. as per 48(1) of the 19th amendment cabinet will only dissolved if and only if prime minister resigns. unless there is no any method to mention that the existing cabinet is dissolved.  these fellows now knows their mistake. 42(4) is not president to appoint prime ministers time to time responsively.  refer 48(1) 48. (1) On the Prime Minister ceasing to hold office by death, resignation or otherwise, except during the period intervening between the dissolution of Parliament and the conclusion of the General Election, the Cabinet of Ministers shall, unless the President has in the exercise of his powers under Article 70, dissolved Parliament, stand dissolved and the President shall appoint a Prime Minister, Ministers of the Cabinet of Ministers, Ministers who are not members of the Cabinet of Ministers and Deputy Ministers in terms of Articles 42, 43, 44 and 45:
This basically means that Maithripala Sirisena simply fooled all of us by saying that he reduced the power of Executive President by bringing the 19th amendment. Wow, what a player. Bravo.
